subject: Relationships
subcategory: Famous Love Stories That Changed History
title: Rodin and Camille Claudel: Love and Betrayal in Art
description: A quick win: understand Rodin and Camille Claudel: Love and Betrayal in Art.

hook.text: She was his student, then his equal, then his forgotten rival. Camille Claudel's talent was stolen by love and sexism.

buildup.text: Claudel became Auguste Rodin's student and lover in 1884. Their artistic collaboration produced masterpieces.

discovery.text: Claudel's own sculptures were extraordinary. But critics attributed her best work to Rodin's influence.

twist.text: Rodin refused to leave his longtime partner. Claudel spiraled. Her family committed her to an asylum for 30 years.

climax.text: Claudel died institutionalized and forgotten. Only decades later was her genius recognized independently.

punchline.text: Claudel spent 30 years in an asylum. Her genius was recognized too late.

quiz.question: What happened to Camille Claudel after her relationship with Rodin?
